intro: Platanthera obtusata, commonly known as the blunt-leaved twayblade, is a terrestrial orchid native to the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a single, erect flowering stem that produces a spike of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and bogs. It has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which aid in nutrient uptake. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
